passage:
(1) The majestic mountains that dominate Earth's landscapes represent some of the most dramatic evidence of our planet's dynamic nature. These imposing features, which can reach heights of several kilometers above sea level, are primarily the result of plate tectonicsâ€”the scientific theory that explains how Earth's outermost layer is divided into several plates that glide over the mantle, the rocky inner layer above the core. This revolutionary concept, only widely accepted in the scientific community since the 1960s, helps us understand not only mountain formation but also earthquakes, volcanoes, and the very shape of our continents and ocean basins.

(2) The most common type of mountain formation occurs at convergent plate boundaries, where two tectonic plates move toward each other. When oceanic and continental plates collide, the denser oceanic plate typically slides beneath the lighter continental plate in a process called subduction. This process generates magma that rises to form volcanic mountain ranges, such as the Andes in South America. Alternatively, when two continental plates collide, neither can subduct fully due to their similar densities. Instead, the enormous pressure forces the land to fold and thrust upward, creating mountain ranges like the Himalayas, which continue to grow taller by several millimeters each year as the Indian subcontinent presses into Asia.

(3) Mountains can also form at divergent boundaries, where tectonic plates move away from each other. As plates separate, magma rises from the mantle to fill the gap, creating new crust. This process primarily occurs along mid-ocean ridges, forming submarine mountain ranges like the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Less commonly, divergent boundaries can form within continents, creating rift valleys flanked by mountains, as seen in East Africa. A third type of formation happens at transform boundaries, where plates slide horizontally past each other, sometimes creating pressure ridges or uplifted blocks that form more modest mountain features.

(4) Beyond plate boundaries, mountains can also form through other geological processes. Hot spots, where plumes of magma rise from deep within the mantle, can create volcanic mountains even in the middle of tectonic plates. The Hawaiian Islands formed this way, as the Pacific Plate moved over a relatively stationary hot spot, creating a chain of increasingly older islands and seamounts. Erosion-resistant rock formations can also become mountains through a process called differential erosion, where surrounding softer rocks wear away over millions of years, leaving harder formations standing as isolated mountains.

(5) The study of mountain formation reveals much about Earth's past and offers insights into its future. By examining rock layers in mountains, geologists can reconstruct ancient environments and climate conditions that existed millions of years ago. Mountain ranges also significantly influence global climate patterns by affecting atmospheric circulation and precipitation. As human activities continue to impact Earth's systems, understanding these massive geological features and the processes that create them becomes increasingly important for predicting how our planet might respond to changes in the future.

questions.question: Select the correct form to complete this sentence: 'If he _____ harder, he would have passed the exam.'

options.A: studied
options.B: studies
options.C: had studied
options.D: would study

questions.question: Choose the correct passive voice construction:

options.A: The report will finish by tomorrow.
options.B: The report will be finished by tomorrow.
options.C: The report will have finish by tomorrow.
options.D: The report will been finished by tomorrow.

questions.question: Which sentence contains the correct use of reported speech?

options.A: She said that she will attend the meeting tomorrow.
options.B: She said that she would attend the meeting the next day.
options.C: She said that she attend the meeting the next day.
options.D: She said that she is attending the meeting tomorrow.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: He's studying the French at a university.
options.B: He's studying French at an university.
options.C: He's studying the French at the university.
options.D: He's studying French at a university.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the present perfect correctly?

options.A: I live here since 2010.
options.B: I am living here since 2010.
options.C: I have lived here since 2010.
options.D: I had lived here since 2010.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement:

options.A: The number of students in the class are increasing.
options.B: A variety of options is available to customers.
options.C: Each of the books have a different cover design.
options.D: Neither of the candidates have withdrawn from the race.

questions.question: Choose the correct modal verb to complete this sentence: 'You _____ be tired after such a long journey.'

options.A: would
options.B: ought
options.C: must
options.D: may to

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of comparative forms:

options.A: This book is more interesting than any book I've read.
options.B: This book is more interesting than all books I've read.
options.C: This book is more interesting than any other book I've read.
options.D: This book is the more interesting than all books I've read.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of relative pronouns:

options.A: The woman which I met yesterday is a doctor.
options.B: The house that they live in it is very old.
options.C: The film who we saw last night won several awards.
options.D: The museum whose exhibition I visited was built in 1890.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a gerund?

options.A: I enjoy to swim in the ocean.
options.B: She suggested to go to the new restaurant.
options.C: They admitted stealing the documents.
options.D: We finished to work on the project yesterday.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of future forms:

options.A: I will having dinner with my parents tomorrow.
options.B: The train will arrives at 6 PM.
options.C: By next month, they will have completed the project.
options.D: She will been working here for five years next week.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct preposition usage:

options.A: She's been working with this company from five years.
options.B: He's afraid from spiders.
options.C: They're responsible of organizing the event.
options.D: I'm interested in learning more about this topic.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of conditionals:

options.A: If I would know the answer, I will tell you.
options.B: Unless you study harder, you would fail the exam.
options.C: If the weather improves, we'll go for a walk.
options.D: If I had more time, I will help you tomorrow.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct verb tense sequence:

options.A: By the time we arrived, the film already started.
options.B: After she has finished her homework, she went to bed.
options.C: She realized that she has lost her keys.
options.D: When I got home, I discovered that someone had broken in.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: The honesty is the best policy.
options.B: I have a useful information for you.
options.C: We need an unanimous decision.
options.D: She plays the piano every evening.

options.A: do
options.B: make
options.C: take
options.D: have

options.A: bring up

options.B: beat around the bush

options.D: bite the bullet

options.D: although

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the word 'collapse'?

options.A: The government collapsed new regulations last week.
options.B: The old building collapsed during the earthquake.
options.C: They collapsed an agreement after lengthy negotiations.
options.D: She collapsed the information into a brief summary.

questions.question: Choose the correct definition of 'inevitable':

options.A: Something that can be avoided with careful planning
options.B: A situation that causes great controversy
options.C: Something certain to happen; unavoidable
options.D: A surprising or unexpected event

questions.question: Which sentence uses the word 'acknowledge' correctly?

options.A: She acknowledged to the store to buy groceries.
options.B: The professor acknowledged the student's excellent work in class.
options.C: They acknowledged the building with modern architecture.
options.D: He acknowledged the tree with decorative lights.

questions.question: Select the sentence that correctly uses 'convert':

options.A: The artist converted a beautiful painting of the landscape.
options.B: She converted against the new policy at the meeting.
options.C: They converted the old factory into luxury apartments.
options.D: He converted the book to his friend after reading it.

questions.question: Choose the best definition of 'collaborate':

options.A: To work together on a shared goal or project
options.B: To compete against others in a professional setting
options.C: To supervise or direct the work of others
options.D: To present information to a large audience

questions.question: In which sentence is 'circumstance' used correctly?

options.A: She circumstanced her opinion clearly during the debate.
options.B: They circumstanced around the obstacle course efficiently.
options.C: Under the circumstances, we decided to postpone the event.
options.D: He circumstanced the project with great attention to detail.

questions.question: Which sentence uses 'anticipate' correctly?

options.A: They anticipate a large crowd at tomorrow's concert.
options.B: She anticipated her car in the parking garage.
options.C: He anticipated with his colleagues on the new project.
options.D: We anticipated the message to all departments.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of 'participate':

options.A: The children participated the toys among themselves.
options.B: She likes to participate novels in her spare time.
options.C: He participated the discussion with insightful comments.
options.D: We encouraged everyone to participate in the community project.

questions.question: Choose the correct usage of 'advocate':

options.A: The lawyer advocates his client in court tomorrow.
options.B: She advocates for stricter environmental regulations.
options.C: They advocated the building last month.
options.D: He advocates to work every day at 9 AM.

questions.question: Which definition best describes 'controversy'?

options.A: A general agreement among a group of people
options.B: A prolonged public discussion or argument, often causing strong feelings
options.C: A formal process for resolving disputes
options.D: A scientific theory that has been proven correct

questions.question: In which sentence is 'contribute' used correctly?

options.A: She contributed the meeting with several good ideas.
options.B: He contributes his children to school every morning.
options.C: They contributed generously to the charity fundraiser.
options.D: We contribute the furniture around the room.

questions.question: Select the sentence that correctly uses 'guarantee':

options.A: The hotel guarantees comfortable accommodations for all guests.
options.B: She guaranteed to the store to return the faulty product.
options.C: They guarantee through the forest to reach the lake.
options.D: He guaranteed the information into a single document.

questions.question: Choose the best definition of 'diminish':

options.A: To make something larger or more impressive
options.B: To make something become less in size, importance, or value
options.C: To completely eliminate or destroy something
options.D: To maintain something at its current level

questions.question: Which sentence uses 'dominate' correctly?

options.A: The castle dominates the landscape from its position on the hill.
options.B: She dominated to the conclusion after careful analysis.
options.C: They dominated the project until next week.
options.D: He dominates with his colleagues every morning.

questions.question: In which sentence is 'undergo' used correctly?

options.A: The city underwent several teams to complete the project.
options.B: She underwent her opinion during the debate.
options.C: The building is undergoing extensive renovations this year.
options.D: They undergo the instructions carefully to avoid mistakes.

questions.question: According to the passage, what is the primary cause of mountain formation on Earth?

options.A: Erosion of surrounding softer rocks
options.B: Volcanic activity from hot spots
options.C: Plate tectonics
options.D: Climate change over millions of years

questions.question: Based on paragraph 2, how are the Andes Mountains formed?

options.A: Through the collision of two continental plates
options.B: By the subduction of an oceanic plate beneath a continental plate
options.C: Through the separation of tectonic plates
options.D: By differential erosion over millions of years

questions.question: Which type of mountain formation occurs at divergent boundaries?

options.A: Folded mountains from continental collision
options.B: Volcanic mountains from subduction
options.C: Mountains formed by rising magma filling gaps between separating plates
options.D: Isolated mountains from differential erosion

questions.question: According to the passage, why do the Himalayas continue to grow taller each year?

options.A: Because of increasing volcanic activity
options.B: Due to the continued pressure of the Indian subcontinent into Asia
options.C: Because of differential erosion of surrounding rocks
options.D: Due to the rising magma from the mantle

questions.question: The word 'subduction' in paragraph 2 refers to:

options.A: The process where one tectonic plate slides beneath another
options.B: The folding of land due to pressure from colliding plates
options.C: The rising of magma from the mantle
options.D: The horizontal sliding of plates past each other

questions.question: According to paragraph 4, how were the Hawaiian Islands formed?

options.A: Through the collision of oceanic and continental plates
options.B: By a stationary hot spot as the Pacific Plate moved over it
options.C: Through the separation of plates at a divergent boundary
options.D: By the horizontal movement of plates at a transform boundary

questions.question: What information can geologists obtain from examining rock layers in mountains?

options.A: Future patterns of plate movement
options.B: The exact age of Earth
options.C: Information about ancient environments and climate conditions
options.D: Predictions about future volcanic eruptions

questions.question: According to the passage, when was plate tectonic theory widely accepted in the scientific community?

options.A: In the 19th century
options.B: Since the early 1900s
options.C: Since the 1960s
options.D: Only in the past decade

questions.question: Based on the passage, what is the relationship between mountain ranges and global climate?

options.A: Mountain ranges have no significant effect on climate
options.B: Mountain ranges influence atmospheric circulation and precipitation
options.C: Mountains only affect local weather, not global climate
options.D: Climate influences mountain formation, but not vice versa

questions.question: What does the author suggest about the importance of understanding mountain formation?

options.A: It is primarily of interest to geologists and has little practical value
options.B: It is only important for predicting earthquakes and volcanic eruptions
options.C: It helps us understand Earth's past and may help predict future changes
options.D: It is less important than studying climate change
